channel.title: Lefthand Journal
channel.description: Minimal editorial essays on chess, geopolitics, philosophy, and technology.

item.title: Opening Repertoires as Personal Essays
item.description: Choosing an opening is choosing the tone of your argument—structured, improvisational, or quietly subversive.

item.title: Protocols of Trust
item.description: Distributed systems are social contracts encoded in code; understanding them requires more than technical diagrams.

item.title: Designing Tools that Disappear
item.description: The best interfaces dissolve into intention, leaving only the work—and the worker—present.

item.title: The Quiet Endgame of Initiative
item.description: When the center clears, initiative becomes a question of tempo, temperament, and patience.

item.title: The Cartography of Meaning
item.description: Philosophy maps the unseen territory between values, choices, and the stories we tell ourselves about both.

item.title: Sanctions as Signals
item.description: Economic penalties are less about punishment than about scripting a public narrative of consequence.

item.title: Sea Lanes and Supply Lines
item.description: The language of shipping manifests reveals which alliances are durable and which are decorative.

item.title: Letters to Future Selves
item.description: Keeping a philosophical journal is an act of correspondence with the person you hope to become.
